titleInfo.title: Cowboys and Cowgirls at Calgary Exhibition, Alta., Canada

name.namePart: The Valentine & Sons Publishing Co., Ltd.

originInfo.publisher: The Valentine & Sons Publishing Co., Ltd.

mods:mods.note: Mounted crowd of cowboys and cowgirls near large building with a cupola
Charlie
617-7 Ave. West, Calgary, Alberta

Feb 27/15. Arrive here on the 24 [$ inst;?], am staying with a friend. Expect to leave again next week for the South. Nothing new. Hope you all are well, with love + kisses. Charlie., Do not write until I send a permanent, address.
Printed in Great Britain
Cowboys and Cowgirls at Calgary Exhibition, Alta., Canada ; 109776, JV [circled]
109776 with JV in clrcle - internal index for Valentine and Sons and refers to the image, not the card. (http://torontopostcardclub.com/canadian-postcard-publishers-2/valentine-sons/)
Family of Native peoples in front of tipis
"Written in ms.: At ""The Stampede"" Calgary 1912 A.P.K Copy Right apld."
Man near roped horse which is attached to the saddle of another horse
Mrs E.H. Burau
Sis Clare
Underwood, Minn.

Well I hope by this (Sat. Morn.) time that Mabel is getting much better. If it only would turn to pneumonia. I hop Ellen sent me a card I am so anxious to hear how the little honey is. Saw in the paper Helen B. was to be marrien in a few wks. I cleaned the front room yesterday + for all the dust. Nell I am going to make them hens lay. if I am going to watch them with a shot gun. I got my coat yesterday, + I guess Ill keep it. Excuse card - Write if u have time. Sis Clare.
Fergus Falls, Minn., 1916-05-13
"Written in ms.: ""The Stampede"". Calgary, Alta. 1912. Official Photo No. 55. Marcell."
No. 55

Woman jumping over a car with a horse
C.H. Joy. Esq.
Alf
Kelly Douglas + Co. Ltd., Vancouver, B.C.

Palliser Hotel. July 16-25. Thursday 11:30 a.m. Dear Mr Joy. Just a line to say Hello, having a lovely time going to Banff + lake Louise to-morrow, will arrive home, Sunday night. Best regards to all. Alf.
Calgary, Alberta, 1925-07-16
Photo Made By The McDermid Photo Laboratories, Calgary Canada
Written in ms.: Bonnie Gray Fancy Trick Rider. Calgary Stampede. No. 598

Founder and Manager of the Stampede from 1912 to 1932.

Rex Sublett on Topsy. C'wright 1921
Written in ms.: Rex Sublett on Topsy. (Copyright 1921 R.R. Doubelday)
Sepia version of PC030520
Mounted native peoples in headdress
Madge
F. Gully
0920 1st Avenue, Sunnyside, Calgary

"So glad to receive your letter intended writing you before. Glad you are still on the old firm. So Spiller has quit. We have had plenty rain here as well. The photo shows Indian Chiefs of 6 different nations lining up to take part in ""The Stampede"" procession. The show was dandy and I never saw horses so wild. They were fresh in from the praries and had never been tamed and cowboys had to ride them for prizes. What they call broncho busting. Goodbye for the time will write again later. With kind regards from, F. Gully"
Written in ms.: Indian Chiefs ; The Stampede Calgary - 1912
Mounted native men with travois in parade

titleInfo.title: Tom Threepersons Champion Rider and Bronco Buster of the World

mods:mods.note: Tom Threepersons in cowboy outfit shaking hands with little girl
Written in ms.: No 6, Tom Threepersons, Macleod Alta, Champion Rider and Bronco Buster of the World, Copyright applied for by, J.E Swenson Macleod Alta
No. 6 Historical Note - Tom Threepersons of the Kainai Nation was the first winner of the Stampede Bronco Busting competition, successfully riding Cyclone to victory

titleInfo.title: The only Buffalo Team in the world

mods:mods.note: Man in chariot pulled by two buffalo
Aunt Nellie
Ruth

Aunt Nellie, I rec'd yours + Aunt Hattie's letters, also Mamas this P.M, + was certainly glad to get them. Was surprised to hear about rain in Ore, we have had rain almost every day since we came. Yesterday was perfect, + today is warm but cloudy. They have the best weather during the fall, sun shines all winter, but gets very cold + have snow, I am pretty tired so please excuse just a few lines this time, Ruth
Written in ms.: The only Buffalo Team in the world, The Stampede Calgary 1912
Parade of mounted native men in headdresses surrounded by spectators
Mrs Bickford [Finlay]
Lillie H[ossell]
5[39] [9]4 ave E. Vancouver BC

Box PO. 1589, Calgary. Dear M. A card to let you know that Jackie and I are enjoying our holiday he is looking so, well and fit. We are staying at a farm. and next week, going to [Nelia?] we will be here al[?] 6 weeks. Kind Regards to you all. Lillie H[ossell].
Calgary, Alta., 1919-09-16
Written in ms.: Parade, Calgary Stampede, 1919
Postmark time 330 pm
Row of wagons lashed together turning a corner pulled by horses

Saw this horse thrown as show in pciture. The rider had to mount him onthe ground, the only way to [?] him. Hope you are quite fit. V.
Claresholm, Alta., 1912-10-31
"Written in ms.: Holding ""Cyclone"" the terror at ""The Stampede"" Calgary, Alta. 1912. Official Photo No. 99. Marcell of Calgary"
No. 99. Cyclone was the star bucking horse of the 1912 Stampede, defeating many riders until Tom Threepersons succesfully rode him.

titleInfo.title: Miss La Due, Champion Lady Fancy Roper of the World

mods:mods.note: Woman in black dress roping a horse and rider in front of a grandstand.
Written in ms.: Miss La Due Champion Lady Fancy Roper of the World at the Stampede. Calgary, Alta. 1912. Official Photo No.96. Marcell of Calgary
No. 96. Florence LaDue was an undefeated champion Lady Fancy Roper for her life. She was married to Guy Weadick, founder of the Stampede.
